intro: Iria mucronata, commonly known as the mucronate iria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Iria mucronata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
